alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 7:52PM EDT until April 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Southern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 752 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Salters to near Wadmalaw Island, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Andrews, Lambert, Sampit, Rhems, Trio, Warsaw, Salters, Earle, Morrisville, Gourdin, Lane and Greeleyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
